body_html:
@lerynth , don't use gcc-4.9 with Ubuntu 16.04
Instead, use gcc-5 (5.3 or 5.4)
The only fix in CUDA 8 you need to do is fixing this line:
/usr/local/cuda/include/host_config.h:81 :
#if __GNUC__ > 4 || (__GNUC__ == 4 && __GNUC_MINOR__ > 9)
to support your version.
You might also consider using an older bazel version (0.22, 0.22b) if it still doesn't work for you.

body:
@lerynth , don't use gcc-4.9 with Ubuntu 16.04
Instead, use gcc-5 (5.3 or 5.4)
The only fix in CUDA 8 you need to do is fixing this line:
`/usr/local/cuda/include/host_config.h:81` :
`#if __GNUC__ > 4 || (__GNUC__ == 4 && __GNUC_MINOR__ > 9)`
to support your version.
You might also consider using an older bazel version (0.22, 0.22b) if it still doesn't work for you.
